english: Don't talk around it.

japanese: 回りくどい言い方はやめてはっきり言ってよ！
english: Stop beating around the bush and give it to me straight!

japanese: 回りくどい言い方はしないでくれ。
english: Don't say it in a roundabout way.

japanese: 回りくどい言い方はしないで。
english: Don't beat around the bush.

japanese: 遠回しに言わないでください。
english: Don't beat around the bush.

japanese: 遠回しに言うな。
english: Don't beat around the bush.

japanese: 遠まわしに物を言うな。
english: Don't beat around the bush.

japanese: 回ってきたんだよ。
english: You have to pay the price.

japanese: 解決法を目下考慮中です。
english: I am considering how to settle the matter.

japanese: 解答はすべて指示に従って書かねばならない。
english: All answers must be written according to the instructions.

japanese: 解決策が功を奏したのは試行錯誤の結果だった。
english: Finding a solution that worked was a process of trial and error.

japanese: 解決策がないのは明らかだった。
english: It was apparent that there was no way out.

japanese: 解決は時間の問題だ。
english: The settlement is a matter of time.

japanese: 解決には時間がかかるという彼の弁明には誰も納得しなかった。
english: His explanation that a solution would take time didn't satisfy anyone.

japanese: 解決しなければならない問題が多い。
english: There are many problems to solve.

japanese: 解決しなければならない問題がたくさんある。
english: There are many problems to solve.

japanese: 解決しなければならぬいくつかの緊急問題がある。
english: We have some pressing problems to solve.

japanese: 解き方を教えてあげるよ。
english: I will show you how to solve it.

japanese: 会話力に磨きをかけるため、彼はフランスに行った。
english: He went to France to brush up on his speaking ability.

japanese: 会話をすれば、たぶん相手についてある種のことが、いとも簡単に分かるだろう。
english: In conversation, one is likely to find out certain things about the other person quite easily.

japanese: 会話は人生最大の喜びの一つであることをご存知か。
english: Do you know that conversation is one of the greatest pleasures in life?

japanese: 会話に参加するためには、何か言うべきことを持っていなければいけない。
english: When you enter a conversation, you should have something to say.

japanese: 会話に参加しませんか。
english: Won't you join our conversation?

japanese: 会話にとって機知は食物に対する塩のようなものである。
english: Wit is to conversation what salt is to food.

japanese: 会話に加われば？
english: Why don't you join in the conversation?

japanese: 会費を払った人たちの名前を消しなさい。
english: Cross off the names of the people who have paid their dues.

japanese: 会費に関しては会の会計係に聞いてください。
english: With regard to the membership fee, you must ask the treasurer of the club.

japanese: 会費が値上げされると多数の会員がやめていった。
english: Many members dropped out of the club when the dues were raised.

japanese: 会堂に鐘の音が響き渡った。
english: The hall resounded with pealing bells.

japanese: 会長選挙でだれに投票しますか。
english: For whom will you vote for president?

japanese: 大統領選挙で誰に投票しますか。
english: For whom will you vote for president?

japanese: 会長は親切にも私の手紙に返事をくださった。
english: The President did me the courtesy of replying to my letter.

japanese: 会長に会う際にはどんなに丁寧にしてもしすぎることはない。
english: You cannot be too polite when you meet the president.

japanese: 会談は２日間続いた。
english: The talks continued for two days.

japanese: 会場は立すいの余地もないほどに聴衆で埋まっていた。
english: The hall was filled with such a large audience that there wasn't even standing room.

japanese: 会場は聴衆でいっぱいだった。
english: This hall was full of people.

japanese: 会場は人であふれ、立錐の余地なしという大盛況だったね。
english: The concert hall was so jam-packed there wasn't room to breathe.

japanese: 会衆は素晴らしい説教に感動した。
english: The congregation was moved by the fine sermon.

japanese: 会社設立２０周年を記念してパーティーを開きました。
english: We held a party in honor of the 20th anniversary of our company.

japanese: 弊社20周年の記念パーティーを開催しました。
english: We held a party in honor of the 20th anniversary of our company.

japanese: 会社気付で彼にこの小包を送ってください。
english: Send this parcel to him in care of his company.

japanese: 会社を立て直すために新しい指導者が必要だ。
english: We need a new leader to pull our company together.

japanese: 事務所を最後に出る人は誰でも明かりを消さなければならない。
english: Whoever leaves the office last should turn off the light.

japanese: 会社を代表して、あなた方すべてに心からの感謝をしたいと思います。
english: On behalf of the company, I would like to express our hearty thanks to you all.

japanese: 会社を経営することと保有することとは違う。
english: Management of a company is different from ownership of a company.

japanese: 会社を危険な目にあわせないで。
english: Don't put the company in danger.

japanese: 会社をクビにならなきゃいいけどね。
english: I hope I can hold on to my job.

japanese: ハンスさんが会社へ特許権を売りました。
english: Hans sold the patent to a company.

japanese: 会社へ電話してください。
english: Call me at the office.

japanese: 会社へ行く途中で財布を盗まれた。
english: I had my wallet stolen on my way to the office.

japanese: 会社は彼を顧問として雇った。
english: The company engaged him as an advisor.

japanese: 会社へ帰ってきたら、私に連絡をとることを忘れるな。
english: When you return to your company, don't forget to keep in touch with me.

japanese: 会社は彼の転勤願いを却下した。
english: The company rejected his request for a transfer.

japanese: 会社は彼の退職の日に金時計を贈った。
english: The company presented him with a gold watch on the day he retired.

japanese: その会社は彼が退職した日に彼に金時計を贈った。
english: The company presented him with a gold watch on the day he retired.

japanese: 会社は通常の月給の他に諸手当で毎月１０万円払ってくれる。
english: The company pays me 100,000 yen in various allowances a month in addition to the regular salary.

japanese: 会社は退職者を募った。
english: The company appealed for people to take voluntary resignation.

japanese: 会社は赤字経営で倒産した。
english: The company was in the red and went under.

japanese: 会社は税金上の目的で本社所在地を香港に移した。
english: The company moved its corporate domicile to Hong Kong for tax purposes.

japanese: 会社は生活するために十分な年金を与えた。
english: The company gave him a large enough pension to live on.

japanese: 会社は深刻な営業不振に陥っている。
english: The company is caught up in a serious business slump.

japanese: 会社は生き残りを賭けて奮闘している。
english: The company is struggling for survival.

japanese: 会社は新しい設備に投資すべきだというのが私たちの助言です。
english: Our advice is that the company invest in new equipment.

japanese: 会社は心配の問い合わせでてんやわんやだった。
english: The office was besieged by anxious inquiries.

japanese: 会社は昇進で彼の業績に報いた。
english: The company rewarded him with promotion.

japanese: 会社は従業員を低賃金で不当に利用した。
english: The company exploited its workers through low wages.

japanese: 会社は時差通勤を導入しようとしています。
english: The company is attempting to stagger work hours.

japanese: 会社は資金不足のため倒産した。
english: The firm went under due to lack of capital.
